title: Question about Papyrus
content:
Would anyone happen to know when Papyrus was first included in a Mac OS?

 [‹ Would you license a library of fonts for $100 per year](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007165042/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42399 "Go to previous forum topic") [What do you look for in a junior designer? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007165042/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42466 "Go to next forum topic")
author: armin

comments.content:
You mean you don’t remember Armin?  
Shame on you!
Off the point, I know… but I’m reminded of [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007165042/http:/www.iheartpapyrus.com/).

Papyrus was one of the “original” OS X fonts —- so that’s 2000, i think.

Here’s a great interview with the creator: [http://www.iheartpapyrus.com/2007/05/interview-with-papyrus-creator-chri...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007165042/http:/www.iheartpapyrus.com/2007/05/interview-with-papyrus-creator-chris.html "http://www.iheartpapyrus.com/2007/05/interview-with-papyrus-creator-chris.html")
